intro: Lupinus honoratus, commonly known as the honor lupine, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its tall, upright growth habit and clusters of showy, pea-like flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant has compound leaves composed of several small, oval-shaped leaflets. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry grasslands and rocky areas. Lupinus honoratus is also valued for its role in soil nitrogen fixation, making it beneficial for ecological restoration projects.
